Changeset.Change: Added SRU consumer model
Changed logger to slf4j
Fixed null timestamp bug
Added method in QueryHelper to get collections, fields etc
Upgraded datanuclues version
Removed geoindex and fwindex classes
Added collection type property in DataCollection entity
Fixed a bug that caused presentables not to be published
Changed Searchable and Presentable fields delete to support delete
Changed schema datatypes to support huge number of fields on datasources
Changed the orm files so the created database is created correctly with the given parameters
Fixed error exception throw at Field delete
Added implementation for read/write policies and refactored all classes to extend base class implementing default behavior.

Revised datasource model for greater flexibility. The model no longer makes any assumption as to the binding of services to specific endpoints. The model can now represent all kinds of data sources: Purely stateless, replicated cluster-bound stateful and purely stateful. Old DataSources are now separated into the DataSource and DataSourceService notions. Each DataSource now optionally points to a set of bound service endpoints.
Added RR elements for Execution Servers and Execution Services.
Added hosting node adapter for node selection lib.
Aligned to latest data store labels.
Fixed store behavior of object graphs of prefetched items
Corrected Field equals method. Previous version caused field updates to be ignored under some circumstances.
Implemented Field update and deletion marking, to support field handling by auto-update functionality
Added search service element.
Fixed property pair representation for hosting nodes. The previous strategy of simply appending keys and pair led to problems matching properties whose key began with a common prefix.
Fixed typo in JDO persistency descriptor for OpenSearch data sources. The typo was a potential source of instability as it resulted in warnings upon querying the latter data sources.
Support for in memory prefetching of element subset for increased query and loading time performance.

Added Element Metadata type. Metadata contain either extra information on existing items or information on items not present in the infrastructure anymore, such as inactive DataSources. Metadata contain implementation agnostic properties, which can be read by whichever repository provider is operating at the given moment. Currently the only element metadata used concerns inactive DataSources.

The scoped delete method in Field deletes a searchable referencing an inactive DataSource only if the metadata of the latter contains scoped information and the caller's scope is contained in this scope information
DataSource.getById() now returns null upon failure.
Changed return type of DataSource related methods in QueryHelper to DataSource.
QueryHelper.getSourceIdsForFieldRelationCollectionLanguage now takes into account inactive data souces.
First Release
